note.p: Birth: His father's house of Footdeesmire, in the Links of Aberdeen, Aberdeenshire, Scotland (23 December 1682)
Burial: The old church of Marylebone, London
Education: Aberdeen Grammar School; Marischal College, Aberdeen (matriculated between 1696 and 1700); Scots College, Rome; Oxford. MA (1749)

Career: Travelled to Holland to stay with relatives and then to Rome, where he studied initially for the priesthood, but abandoned this course and studied architecture under Carlo Fontana, surveyor-general to Pope Clement XI; practised as an architect in London (1709-death); Surveyor to the Commissioners for Building Fifty New Churches in London (1713-1715), when he was dismissed as a suspected Jacobite; worked on the development of the Harley estate in Marylebone, under the patronage of Edward Harley, 2nd Earl of Oxford (FRS 1727); Architect of the Ordnance (1727-death); his buildings include the Radcliffe Library, Oxford, and (despite the fact that he was a Roman Catholic) St Martin-in-the-Fields, Westminster, and St Mary-le-Strand, London among other churches; bequeathed his books, prints and drawings to the Radcliffe Library
Notes: Proposed by William Jones, William Rutty, Sir Hans Sloane
